result.execSummary:
The defendant Walter B Beasley was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Walter B Beasley is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Walter B Beasley was found guilty of Forgery-Uttering, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant discharged from probation on 7-29-19; unpaid restitution of $322.85, court obligations of $707.29, and supervision fees of $720

Walter Beasley 4326 Crawford Drive Madison WI 53711
 - Judgment for Unpaid Fines, Forfeitures and Other Financial Obligations
 - Moved Left No Address, Unable to Forward, Return to Sender

04:08 PM Defendant Walter B Beasley in court, appearing telephonically from the Dane County Jail in custody with attorney Nicole Vander Meulen appearing telephonically.  Jordan Lippert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Probation Agent is not present, Atty Lippert requesting probation be extended for defendant to pay Restitution,  Atty Vander Meulen calls witness Walter Beasley, sworn, 4:14 P.M. testimony taken, State takes no position, Court finds defendant has made good faith effort to pay Restitution, Court orders all remaining fees/Restitution be converted into a civil judgment, 4:19 P.M.

Filed by DOC: Agent Perry will be out of office and unable to attend the probation review hearing. Agent Wachtendonk requesting to appear by phone.

APPROVED.
Notice of Hearing for 7/10/2019 mailed to Defendant at 4326 Crawford Dr, Madison, WI 53711 returned as Moved left no address, unable to forward
Probation review hearing on July 10, 2019 at 04:00 pm.
Filed by ADA Jordan Lippert requesting a probation review hearing prior to 7/29/19.
Hearing to be set.
to enter civil judgment

Defendant Walter B Beasley in court with attorney Nicole Vander Meulen.  Troy D Cross appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Waiver of Right to Prelim filed, Court accepts Waiver, probable cause found, bound over, Information filed, waives reading, Rights/Elements, Defendant pleads no contest to Ct. 1, Judgment to be entered, Ct. 2 dismissed, Court withholds sentence, probation 2 years, $1,892.85 Restitution plus surcharge, $518.00 costs, Defendant to submit DNA Sample, Court would allow early termination of probation if Restitution is paid in full

Defendant Walter B Beasley in court with attorney Nicole Vander Meulen.  Jane E. Kohlwey appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Vander Meulen requested a new return date to allow her to get funds released for defendant to reach the terms set with State.  State had no objection.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
